Job Title: Multiple Roles - IT and Cyber Security, Identity and Access Management
Company: Australian Transaction Reports and Analysis Centre (AUSTRAC)
Category:
Security (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - Federal (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
AUSTRAC, Australia‚Äôs financial intelligence agency, is evolving to strengthen its fight against money laundering and terrorism financing. As we expand our regulatory reach and broaden our digital transformation, this introduces new technologies and threats. We are now recruiting several, leadership positions to strengthen the agency's IT and Cyber Security function. These role offers a unique opportunity to help shape cyber security strategy and champion positive security culture across AUSTRAC. We're looking for strategic and people-focussed leaders to lead cross-functional IT teams in navigating an evolving threat landscape. You'll guide cross-functional teams and create an atmosphere where people feel empowered and encouraged to contribute their best ideas. If you embrace challenges diligently, passionate about leading teams in a collaborative environment, and eager to make a meaningful impact we encourage you to apply!

This recruitment process will be used to fill both ongoing and non-ongoing vacancies and build a merit pool for future roles over the next 18 months.¬†

Director IT Security /IT Security Advisor (ITSA) EL2¬†

The Director, IT Security / IT Security Advisor (ITSA) leads AUSTRAC‚Äôs IT Security function, with direct responsibility for managing a small, high-performing information security team. The ITSA supports the delivery of the agency‚Äôs cyber security strategy and ensures that security practices, systems, and advice are continuously improved and aligned with national standards and internal priorities. This position works closely with Executives and governance forums to uplift cyber maturity and deliver secure outcomes across the organisation.¬†

Key duties include:¬†

Providing operational leadership to AUSTRAC‚Äôs IT Security team, setting direction, allocating priorities, and managing performance to ensure effective delivery of security services, compliance activities, and internal capability uplift.
Providing high-level insights and trusted advice to executive leadership, translating complex cyber policy and risk matters into clear strategic impacts.
Driving the ongoing development and refinement of security risk frameworks. Providing subject matter expertise on risk tolerance, control assurance, and compliance against relevant legislative, audit, and operational requirements.
Representing the agency at inter-agency forums and with external partners, shaping whole-of-government discussions on security policy and aligning standards.

Director Identity and Access Management (IDAM) EL2

The Director Identity & Access Management (IDAM) leads the IDAM function delivering the IDAM roadmap in alignment with AUSTRAC‚Äôs Cybersecurity Strategy Roadmap and Implementation Plan. The role provides strategic leadership, technical oversight, and governance across enterprise identity, authentication, and authorisation services to safeguard AUSTRAC‚Äôs systems and data.

Key duties include:¬†

Providing operational leadership to AUSTRAC‚Äôs Identity and Access Management Team,¬†
setting direction, allocating priorities, and managing performance to ensure effective delivery of identity and access management services, compliance activities, and internal capability uplift.
Delivering the IDAM roadmap, milestones, and outcomes per the AUSTRAC Cybersecurity Strategy Roadmap and Implementation Plan, translating strategic objectives into actionable programs and projects with clear success measures, benefits, and risk controls
Implementing and maintaining IDAM controls aligned to ISM/PSPF, Essential Eight, ISO 27001, and applicable privacy obligations including the management of identity related risks, assurance activities, and audit findings while driving continual control uplift, identity threat modelling, and identity detection/response in partnership with Cyber Operations.
Partnering with business owners, product teams, and security stakeholders to embed identity requirements in change initiatives.

Lead Analyst Operational Security EL1

The Lead Analyst, Security Advisory is a key member of the Technology Platforms and Solutions Operational Security team within the Innovation and Technology Solutions (ITS) branch. This position will collaborate with IT, business stakeholders, and senior leadership to ensure that the AUSTRAC ITS branch can meet the security policy requirements and support projects and operational teams in maintaining a strong security posture.¬†

Key duties include:¬†

Delivering security analytics, analysis, and audits across a broad range of security data sources.
Maintaining a high awareness of external and insider threats and responding accordingly.
Developing and maintaining Information Security policies, procedures, and other documentation to ensure effective storage, coverage, review, and sign-off.
Leading Information Security projects and initiatives and conducting risk assessments for internal and external systems and applications, ensuring risk is managed accordingly.

For more information about the role and the capabilities where looking for, please refer to the Candidate Pack on the¬†AUSTRAC Careers Page

Affirmative Measures

This vacancy is also being advertised concurrently under both general and affirmative measures recruitment processes.

Applications made under affirmative measures are only available to¬†affirmative measures indigenous¬†applicants or¬†affirmative measures disability¬†applicants.

Evidence will be requested if your application progresses under an affirmative measures process.

Notes

This recruitment process will initially be used to fill a current vacancy and in future, may be used to fill similar positions in the event positions become vacant. The merit pools established from this recruitment process will be valid for 18 months from the date of advertising.

We offer competitive remuneration and great conditions, including:

Annual leave of 4 weeks (20 days) per year + additional paid Christmas close down.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Cultural, Ceremonial and NAIDOC leave.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†18 days of paid personal leave per year.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†15.4% superannuation, which continues through paid parental leave.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†18 weeks of paid parental leave.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Competitive APS salaries with access to annual salary progression.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Study assistance - up to $6,000 per annum and up to 120 hours of study leave.

View the¬†AUSTRAC Enterprise Agreement¬†for more information about current salaries and other conditions of employment.

About Us

AUSTRAC, Australia‚Äôs financial intelligence agency and anti-money laundering and terrorism financing regulator, is undergoing a significant transformation to enhance its role in combating money laundering and terrorism financing. This includes proposed expansion of its regulatory regime and a broader digital transformation to support our growing agency. As we embrace these changes and grow, our focus is on fostering innovation, collaboration, and effective problem-solving within an inclusive and supportive work environment. At AUSTRAC, you‚Äôll be part of a team dedicated to maintaining the integrity of Australia‚Äôs financial system and making a real impact in preventing financial crime.

Closing Date and further details¬†

Applications close at¬†11:30 pm on Sunday 11 January 2026

For enquiries, please contact:¬†ict.recruitment@austrac.gov.au

Please note, we can only accept applications via the AUSTRAC Careers Portal.

Company: Talent ‚Äì Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
Business Analyst
üìç Adelaide, SA | üìÖ 12-month contract (commencing Feb 2026, high likelihood of extension) | Hybrid arrangements

Project Overview

Our client is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to support upcoming projects across their portfolio. This key role focuses on delivering customer-focused, scalable solutions that meet business and operational requirements. The BA will initially work on planning activities, including project scoping, tendering, and business case preparation, before moving into broader project delivery or other applications-based initiatives. The role requires collaboration with stakeholders, process improvement, and contributing to the successful delivery of practical, business-focused outcomes.










Key Responsibilities

Capture, analyse, and document business requirements

Map as-is and to-be processes to identify gaps and improvement opportunities

Facilitate stakeholder workshops and manage expectations

Support project lifecycle activities, including initiation, planning, and operational handover

Apply lean process improvement to identify areas of waste and enhance efficiency

Contribute to procurement processes (RFP, RFQ, RFT) and evaluation support where required

Lead project planning activities when PM support is limited

Skills & Experience

Strong core BA skills - requirements gathering, workshops, data analysis, benefits realisation

Confident communicator, able to translate complex technical concepts into lay terms

Agile environment experience, without necessarily implementing Agile methodology

Experience in utilities, mining, or similar sectors highly desirable

Dynamic, flexible, and creative with the ability to deliver innovative solutions

Why Join

Work on a high-profile, strategic project delivering tangible impact

Hybrid working arrangement balancing on-site collaboration with remote work

Opportunity to contribute across multiple projects in a fast-paced, evolving IT environment

Work within a team aligned to our clients' values: safety, initiative, collaboration, and rising to the challenge

If you are interested, call Ella at 0480 804 548 to speak further about this position.

A federal government agency providing analytical advice and insight on a range of economic and policy themes, supporting decision-making on complex, economy-wide policy questions, including those relating to labour markets and productivity
¬†
The Opportunity
Newly created roles
2x positions available
Work on high-profile research programs exploring labour market efficiency, productivity, and workforce dynamics. Join a multidisciplinary team of economists, data scientists, and policy specialists, applying advanced modelling to complex linked administrative data to generate insights that inform national decision-making.

The project pipeline includes applying search and matching models to determine outcomes for specific cohorts, analysing labour market and productivity trends, and producing dashboards and visualisations to support evidence-based advice.

Flexible working arrangements are supported, with most team members attending the office around two days per week.

The Role

You will:

Support analysis and modelling across multiple high-impact research programs
Apply search and matching models to understand outcomes for specific cohorts
Analyse labour market and productivity trends, producing dashboards and visualisations to guide evidence-based advice
Assist and mentor team members, contributing to high-quality, timely analytical outputs across a multidisciplinary, dispersed team
The work is primarily undertaken in Azure Databricks using PySpark, but the team is flexible and also uses R and SQL. Visualisations are delivered via Highcharts, Power BI, R Shiny and Qlik, ensuring insights are accessible, reproducible, and well-documented.
¬†
The Ideal Person

You are an experienced data scientist or applied economist with a strong interest in labour markets, productivity and workforce dynamics, and you enjoy working at the intersection of data, economics and public policy.

You may be coming from organisations including ABS, ATO, Treasury, DEWR, Health, DSS or Big 4/Economic focused consulting.

You may have worked on economic modelling, workforce analysis, productivity research, skills forecasting or evaluation work, and are comfortable applying advanced quantitative methods to real-world policy questions.

You bring:

Experience applying advanced quantitative methods, including multilevel modelling and Bayesian inference
Experience with labour market analysis, applied economics, workforce dynamics or productivity research
Robust and methodical approach to analysis whilst being skilled at translating complex data into actionable policy insights
Australian citizenship and existing Baseline clearance is mandatory
¬†
Salary / Rate

This is a full-time contract commencing in February for an initial 12 month contract with 12 month extension

A rate is not listed; however, my estimation range is $135/hr - $160/hr based on skills and experience.
¬†
How to Apply

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link.
¬†
Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Lucas Walker on 0483 911 561 quoting ref no. 21228
¬†
HorizonOne is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and we encourage applications from people of all cultures, capabilities and backgrounds.

Consulting Manager/Director - Data & AI

Lead data-driven transformation and AI-enabled outcomes for clients.
We're seeking an experienced Consulting Manager/Director - Data & AI to lead high-impact consulting engagements and grow our Data & AI consulting capability.

This is a senior, client-facing role where you'll combine people leadership, delivery excellence, and commercial acumen to help clients solve complex data, analytics, and AI challenges.

You'll work closely with clients and internal teams to deliver scalable data platforms, advanced analytics, and AI-enabled solutions that drive real business value.

What you'll do

Lead, mentor, and grow a team of Data, Analytics, and AI consultants, fostering a collaborative and innovative culture.
Build and maintain trusted executive-level client relationships, understanding data and AI challenges and delivering tailored solutions.
Collaborate with technical and delivery teams to design and deliver Data, Analytics, and AI solutions including data platforms, BI, ML, and AI use cases.
Identify and develop new business opportunities across Data & AI engagements and expand existing client accounts.
Lead proposal development, client presentations, and contract negotiations for Data & AI initiatives.
Contribute to the strategic direction and growth of the Data & AI consulting practice.
Support oversight of financial performance, ensuring engagements are delivered within budget and meet profitability targets.
Partner with other service lines to deliver a cohesive, end-to-end client experience.
What you'll bring

Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline, or equivalent practical experience.
7+ years' experience in industry or consulting, including 3+ years in a consulting leadership role focused on Data, Analytics, or AI.
Proven track record delivering Data & AI consulting engagements, from strategy through to implementation.
Strong understanding of data platforms, analytics, AI/ML concepts, and modern data architectures.
Experience with consulting methodologies, program delivery, and stakeholder management.
Commercial mindset with experience in business development, account growth, and client management.
Excellent leadership, communication, and presentation skills.
A continuous learning mindset, staying current with emerging data, analytics, and AI trends.
Nice to have

Postgraduate qualification such as an MBA or Master's in Data, Analytics, or AI.
Relevant certifications (e.g. PMP, SAFe, cloud or data platform certifications).
Exposure to cloud data platforms (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP) and AI frameworks.
Why join us?

Lead and grow a high-performing Data & AI consulting practice.
Work with leading organisations on complex, high-value data and AI transformations.
Influence strategy and capability development within a growing consulting division.
Competitive remuneration, flexible working, and strong career progression opportunities.
Ready to lead the next wave of Data & AI consulting?
Apply now and help clients turn data into insight and AI into impact.
Australian workrights needed, security clearance a bonus.

Business Analysts, Project Managers & Change Managers
Cyber Security Projects | Contract Opportunities | Brisbane / Hybrid
¬†
We are partnering with large enterprise and government organisations delivering critical cyber security initiatives and are seeking experienced Business Analysts, Project Managers and Change Managers (consultants) to support multiple programs of work.
¬†
These roles will suit professionals who have hands-on experience working across cyber security, risk, compliance and technology uplift programs in complex environments.
¬†
About the Opportunities

You will work across a range of cyber security initiatives, including:
Cyber uplift and remediation programs
Identity & Access Management (IAM)
GRC, risk and compliance initiatives
Security architecture, tooling and control improvements
Regulatory, audit and assurance-driven programs
Key Responsibilities (Depending on Discipline)
Business Analysts

Eliciting and documenting business, functional and non-functional requirements
Translating cyber security, risk and technical concepts into clear documentation
Supporting solution design, traceability and delivery
Working closely with security, architecture and delivery teams
Project Managers

Leading end-to-end delivery of cyber security projects
Managing scope, schedule, budget, risks and dependencies
Coordinating vendors, security teams and internal stakeholders
Driving delivery across regulatory and compliance-driven timelines
Change Managers

Leading change impact assessments and stakeholder engagement
Developing and delivering change, communication and training plans
Supporting adoption of new security processes, tools and ways of working
Working closely with delivery and security teams to embed change
About You

You are an experienced consultant who has:
Proven experience delivering cyber security-related projects
Background in complex, regulated or enterprise environments
Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills
Experience working alongside security, risk, technology and business teams
Consulting or contract experience is highly regarded
What's on Offer

Multiple contract opportunities across cyber security programs
Competitive daily rates
Hybrid working arrangements (Brisbane-based)
Opportunity to work on meaningful, high-impact security initiatives
If you're a Business Analyst, Project Manager or Change Manager with cyber security project experience and are looking for your next contract, we'd love to hear from you.

Whitehaven Coal¬†is the¬†dominant player in Australia‚Äôs only emerging high-quality coal basin. With a culture based on our STRIVE values, our reputation for excellence in project delivery and safe, efficient and environmentally responsible operations continues to grow.

¬†
Our STRIVE¬†Values connect us and define how we behave.¬†Whitehaven Coal award, recognise and celebrate individuals and teams going above and beyond the requirements of their role to deliver excellent outcomes while demonstrating our values of¬†Safety,¬†Teamwork,¬†Respect,¬†Integrity,¬†Value¬†and¬†Excellence.




About The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated¬†Commercial Analyst¬†to join our dynamic team. This role is a fixed term 12 month contract and is based in our Newcastle office.




Accountable for oversight of the revenue stream at Whitehaven Coal, with a strong focus on the development and coordination of the annual revenue budget and ongoing monthly revenue forecasting. The role supports forward-looking revenue planning through analysis of sales volumes, pricing assumptions, shipment timing, and market conditions, providing insight to senior management and the Board to support decision-making.




The position is responsible for forecasting and monitoring demurrage and other voyage-related revenue impacts, ensuring these are appropriately reflected in revenue outlooks. The role also supports a robust control environment across sales operations by maintaining disciplined forecasting processes, assumptions governance, and alignment between marketing, commercial and finance teams.


What You‚Äôll Do

Develop annual budgets and forecasts in collaboration with relevant stakeholders and monitor the performance against those budgets and forecasts
Assist with the completion of sales forecasts based on market trends, customer demand, and production capacity.
Collaborate with sales and operations teams to ensure alignment between sales targets and operational capabilities.
Prepare and present regular sales performance reports to management, highlighting key metrics and trends.
Assist in reporting of value generation achieved via purchase and blending of third-party coals
Conduct ad-hoc analysis and special projects as requested by senior management, providing timely and accurate insights to support strategic initiatives
Assist with preparation of ELT, Board and Leadership Team reports

What You‚Äôll Bring¬†

Proven experience in commercial analysis, preferably within the coal industry or related sectors.
Proficiency in financial modelling, forecasting, and budgeting.
Degree qualified in Accounting, Commerce, Business or Law
Experience dealing with multiple stakeholder inputs both internal and external
The ability to build and maintain strong and trusted relationships across all levels of the business
Experience and understanding of international and domestic coal markets (desirable)
Experience in the coal industry across coal mining, coal processing and logistics chain (Desirable)




Why Whitehaven Coal?

Career development, mentorship and coaching
Australian owned industry leader
Attractive remuneration package
Employee referral scheme - $4000 for successful referrals
12 month contract opportunity




Whitehaven Coal¬†is committed to increasing the representation of women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples in the workplace. We strive for an inclusive workplace that engages people from diverse backgrounds and welcomes diversity of gender, culture and experience.

Job Title: Dig Del Support - Senior Data Engineer
Salary: Base + Super + Full NFP Salary packaging benefits
Ad Text:
Senior Data Engineer

10-month fixed-term contract
Marsden Street, Parramatta (hybrid working available)

About Uniting

Our purpose: To inspire people, enliven communities and confront injustice.
Our values: Imaginative, Respectful, Compassionate and Bold.

At Uniting, we take real steps to make the world a better place. Our focus is always on the people we serve, wherever they are in life.

We deliver services across aged care, disability, child and family services, community services and chaplaincy, alongside strong social justice and advocacy work. We celebrate diversity and welcome all people regardless of lifestyle choices, ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation or gender identity.

Uniting is the services and advocacy arm of the Uniting Church NSW & ACT. Our leaders understand, support and can articulate the mission and purpose of the Uniting Church.

About the role

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will design, build and maintain scalable, secure and high-quality data platforms that enable analytics, reporting and advanced data use across Uniting.

Working within the Data Engineering Chapter in the Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with data analysts, data architects and business stakeholders. You will provide technical leadership, contribute to architectural decisions, and help uplift data engineering practices to support informed, data-driven decision-making across the organisation.

This role is a 10-month fixed-term contract and reports to the Chapter Lead ‚Äì Data Engineering, within the Property, Finance & IT directorate.

Key accountabilities

In this role, you will:

Integrate diverse data sources to create trusted, accessible datasets
Architect and implement solutions to support large-scale data processing
Automate data ingestion, transformation and delivery workflows
Monitor system performance, identify bottlenecks and implement improvements
Apply best practice in data security, access controls and compliance
Provide technical leadership through code reviews, mentoring and design guidance
Evaluate and adopt new tools and frameworks to enhance data engineering capability

About you

You are an experienced, hands-on data engineer who thrives in complex environments and enjoys partnering with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. You bring strong problem-solving skills, a collaborative approach, and the confidence to guide technical outcomes while remaining pragmatic and delivery-focused.

As a staff member at Uniting, you actively support diversity and inclusion and work in ways that reflect our values.

Your capabilities

Individual leadership

Takes ownership of outcomes and delivers with a proactive, ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù mindset
Works collaboratively to improve performance and ways of working
Remains resilient and focused when navigating complexity
Plans and delivers work within agreed timeframes

Business acumen

Understands Uniting‚Äôs objectives and how this role contributes to them
Applies organisational values to day-to-day decision-making
Analyses problems, seeks input where appropriate and implements effective solutions
Builds strong relationships and influences outcomes without direct authority




Qualifications and experience

Essential

Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Information Technology, Systems Engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent professional experience
10+ years‚Äô experience designing, developing and supporting data engineering, analytics and ML solutions
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL
Proven experience designing and managing ETL/ELT pipelines
Solid understanding of data modelling, governance, quality and security
Experience working with non-technical stakeholders, demonstrating strong communication, empathy and insight
Proficiency with Git or similar source control tools
Ability to quickly learn and apply new tools and technologies

Highly regarded

Experience with cloud data platforms, particularly Microsoft Azure (e.g. Azure Data Factory)
Experience with Snowflake, including schema design, performance tuning and secure data sharing
DevOps and automation experience (e.g. Python scripting, API integration, automated releases)
Exposure to predictive analytics, machine learning or statistical techniques (Python/R)

Direct report to the Chief Executive at a leading independent health research organisation

Lead an engaged, high calibre team to solve some of Australia‚Äôs most complex health and wellbeing challenges using evidence and research

Exciting role bringing together business development and relationship management whilst delivering high quality consulting projects, which improve public health outcomes

The Organisation

The Sax Institute is an independent, not-for-profit organisation that improves health and wellbeing by driving better use of evidence in policies, programs and services. The Institute has an international reputation as an Evidence Specialist, with nearly 20 years' experience in translating research findings into policy drawing on our own expertise as well as that of our more than 80 member organisations. It works with governments, health organisations, research organisations and a network of experts nationwide to analyse policy problems and find the best evidence-based solutions.

Its work spans a broad portfolio of programs and services, including; The 45 and Up Study, SURE (Secure Unified Research Environment), Evidence Check, Dynamic Simulation, Aboriginal Health Division, The Australian Prevention Partnership Centre and the Evaluation and Impact Services Division, which this role leads.

Evidence and Impact Division

Sax Institute‚Äôs Evaluation and Impact Services team delivers high-quality, independent evaluations that help organisations understand the effectiveness, value and outcomes of their programs and policies. With deep expertise in health and social policy, the team works across government, non-profit and community sectors to provide actionable insights that drive improvement and innovation.

The Role

The Head, Evidence and Impact Division is a senior executive role reporting to the Chief Executive and responsible for the strategic development and operational management of the Division. This is an exciting role that continues to expand the Institute‚Äôs impact through business development, strategic relationship management, and the delivery of high-quality programs.

This role will be responsible for building and maintaining a strong pipeline of opportunities in a competitive marketplace; balancing multiple complex consulting projects simultaneously; and managing client expectations. The role will position the Division and the Institute for growth whilst maintaining a reputation for independence and analytical excellence, and foster whole of Institute collaboration to leverage all Institute capabilities in service delivery.

The Individual

Essential

Postgraduate qualifications, preferably in public health, health policy, health services, research or related.

10+ years‚Äô experience in health policy, strategy and planning, evidence mobilisation, modelling, program review and evaluation, and impact assessment.

Demonstrated ability to problem solve at a high level and develop, implement and evaluate innovative solutions to complex policy challenges.

Substantial leadership experience in leading multi-disciplinary teams, operational and budget management, bringing excellence in methodology and analytical rigour.

A proactive approach to developing and nurturing a strong network of professional contacts across government and the health sectors.

Desirable

Publication in peer reviewed journals.

Understanding of health system design and reform.




For a confidential discussion, please call Bronwen Kerr, Jocelyn Hinder or Daniel Nicholls on 02 9233 1200. ¬†

To obtain a copy of the Candidate Brief for this role, please visit: watermarksearch.com.au/position-descriptions

To express interest, please send your application quoting Ref No A006163 to Watermark Search International via the form below. We will reply to the email address used for your application.

https://watermarksearchinternational.snapforms.com.au/form/application-form-sydney-search

Closing date: Wednesday 14 January 2026 at 11.59pm AEDT

Job Title: Digital Experience Monitoring (DEM) SME / Delivery Lead
Ad Text:
Company description:



CAPGEMINI SERVICE SAS



Job description:

Your Role

As a Digital Experience Monitoring (DEM) Tool SME within the Experience Management Office, you will play a key role in shaping and elevating the digital experiences of our employees. You'll be responsible for the expert management, configuration, and optimization of DEM platforms such as SysTrack and Nexthink. About Proa Energy

Proa is heavily investing in expanding its energy management platform, delivering cutting-edge solutions for utility-scale renewable energy assets in Australia and around the world. Our multidisciplinary team of engineers, meteorologists, physicists, and IT specialists is rapidly expanding. We're currently seeking a Data Analytics Manager to lead our data scientists and analysts in designing and building advanced analytics solutions that drive the optimal operation of renewable energy assets.




About the Role

As the Data Analytics Manager, you will sit on the management team, reporting directly to the Managing Director, and lead the Data Analytics Team in delivering actionable insights and innovative solutions for utility-scale renewable assets. You will coordinate analytics activities across advanced modelling, software development, operations, and client management, ensuring that new products and R&D projects are deployed efficiently and at high quality. This is a unique opportunity to influence the future of energy management by building and deploying advanced analytics systems (forecasting, dispatch, bidding, data cleaning, ML, etc), supporting clients in optimizing their renewable energy assets, and engaging in ‚Äúblue-sky‚Äù thinking about new products and solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Team Leadership ‚Äì Manage a group of 8‚Äì10 data scientists and analysts, fostering a collaborative environment and delivering deep insights from the data generated by utility-scale renewable assets.

Expert Technical Advice ‚Äì Guide R&D data science projects, brainstorming technical solutions and contributing to new product development.

Operational Analytics ‚Äì Supervise and optimise the development, deployment, and monitoring processes of systems running operationally 24x7 for critical infrastructure.

Cross-team coordination ‚Äì Work closely with product development, software, operations, and client management teams to ensure analytics solutions are integrated and deployed on time and to a high standard.

Regulatory Compliance ‚Äì Understand market operator regulations and integrate them correctly into Proa‚Äôs systems.

Advanced modelling support ‚Äì Develop and oversee advanced models in optimisation, forecasting, dispatch, data quality filtering, etc. for wide a variety of large scale renewable energy projects (solar, wind, batteries, hybrids, etc.).

System Architecture, Operation and Maintenance ‚Äì Lead the architecture, operation and maintenance of ¬†Proa‚Äôs analytics systems, ensuring processes remain robust, reliable, and scalable.




Skills and Experience

7+ years of experience leading technical teams.

Strong background in data science, algorithm design, machine learning, and physical science.

Experience working with cloud data environments, preferably Azure.

Proficiency in Python and MATLAB, or similar tools.

Strong problem-solving abilities and experience in software architecture and system design.

Excellent communication skills and the ability to lead, mentor, and motivate a technical team..




Desirable Skills

Knowledge of Australian energy regulations, particularly AEMO and NER rules.

Experience building optimisation systems for BESS and hybrid operations.

Experience running real-time operations for renewable energy plants.

On-site asset management and O&M operations experience at renewable energy plants.

Experience with advanced analytics, predictive modeling, or operational optimization in energy systems.




What We Offer

Competitive salary and benefits package.

Career growth and leadership development opportunities.

A collaborative, inclusive, and supportive work environment.

Flexible hybrid work arrangements.

Proa Energy is proud to be a Work180 Endorsed Employer, dedicated to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We support work-life balance and encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, including women, culturally diverse candidates, and people with disabilities.
